After going down the *Leica path to extremism* over the last few years, I felt compelled to jot down a few notes and thoughts. Originally, I wrote this for a few friends who've recently purchased Leica cameras (Q2, and a M11). Thinking it might benefit others, I'm sharing it here. YMMV.

{{< image src="/images/posts/photos-congee.jpg" caption="Congee spot in Guangzhou. Leica Q. 2016">}}


I have shot with Leica cameras since I got the og Q in 2016. Since then I have gone through the [Q](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Leica_Q_), the [OG monochrom](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Leica_M_Monochrom) (my very fav camera of all time), a [262](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Leica_M_(Typ_262)) (Purchased with 10 BTC lol), and now I am shooting with a [M11](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Leica_M11). I really enjoy them. I enjoy the community and I like the vibe.

Someone once told me that Leica cameras are [Birkin bags](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Birkin_bag) for men. Lol. Not wrong. This isn't bad - but is funny.

## Shooting

{{< image src="/images/posts/photos-karin.jpg" caption="Karin Tanabe. Leica M (Typ 262), Summilux 50mm. 2022. ">}}

Don’t listen to me. Find your friend who is way better at photography and ask them. Barring that, here is what worked for me.

- The only way to get good is to shoot it constantly.
- I carried a camera almost everyday from 2016 until Covid.
- If you are shooting an M, learn to zone focus. It is helpful. I rarely use it in real life - but it was super helpful to learn. Taught me a lot about my camera.
- You almost never need a zoom lens. As my friend [Trammell](https://twitter.com/trammell) told me: "Zoom with your feet."
- Take a bunch of classes at a [local photography spot](https://www.latitudechicago.org/education). Every city has one. Find it, make friends, and take classes. None of them will be too easy. You will learn a lot.
    - I took a lighting class that blew my mind
- Print at a [local photo printing lab](https://www.latitudechicago.org/printing-services). Its fun and you learn a lot
- Take your camera everywhere. The Q is super durable. I have hit it against everything and it still works great. Same with the Ms. They are like bricks.
- My goal is to break my cameras while using them. My biggest fear is that they will get broken while they are sitting on a counter or a shelf. They are meant to be used.
- I shoot full auto. 100% all the time full auto. Even on the M (obviously manual focus). A lot of photographers will do everything on manual. I do not have time for that. Lol. Those same people will give you shit about shooting on auto. Fuck em.
- Play with the macro mode. its fun.
- One of my favorite rules of thumb for photography is: **Remove variables for better results**
    - Shoot in black and white!
    - Don't use liveview
    - Shoot only in f/8 (i know not "auto", but on the M the lens is fully manual. life is complicated)
    - also works for most things in life
- Share your [photos](https://harper.photos)!

# Buying

{{< image src="/images/posts/photos-eamon-singing.jpg" caption="Eamon singing, Chris Laughing. Leica Q. 2018. ">}}

Everyone needs a “Leica guy” to help maintain the constant drip of Leica cameras into their life. You already made the decision to get a camera based on fashion, just lean into it and live the lifestyle.

- My go-to Leica shop is [Tamarkin camera in Chicago](https://www.tamarkin.com/). They are solid and helpful. Tell Dan that Harper sent you.
- [Leica Miami](https://leicastoremiami.com/) is a decent store to buy from on the internet.
- Be careful of ordering off Amazon. [Lots of counterfeit](https://www.techdirt.com/2018/01/17/homeland-securitys-over-obsession-with-counterfeits-now-harming-innocent-buyers-counterfeit-goods-online/).
- Lot's of great equipment is waiting to be bought used. I got my dear Summilux, and my beloved Monochrom used. They are both perfect. Just make sure you are buying from someone ruputable, and trustworthy.
- If you are not using a piece of equipment, sell it. Better yet, give it to someone who will love it.

## Equipment

{{< image src="/images/posts/photos-dj.jpg" caption="My friend DJ. Leica M11, Summilux 50mm. 2023. ">}}

Sometimes the photography hobby is less about photography and more about equipment. I try to make sure I have minimized my gear acquisition syndrome ([GAS](https://www.theinspiredeye.net/cameras/gear-acquisition-syndrome/)) and focused on shooting.

- Lenses. OMG. I have gone through a lot of lenses. I finally settled on shooting primarily with a [50m Summilux](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Summilux). Through a bunch of experimentation I realized I like how 50mm works, how it looks, and how it frames.
- I have never traveled with more than one lens.
- Learning on a fast lens is a nightmare cuz the super shallow depth of field. When I first started out, I was hitting on 5% of my shots. VERY frustrating. Call Dan at Tamarkin and buy a vintage summicron.  You will adore it, and you will have more fun. *Then* go for the fast af lens that costs a million dollars.
- I don’t really use a camera bag. I typically put my camera in a pouch, and then in my tote, or backpack. I want it quickly accessible.
	- I have always liked the [Artisan and Artist](https://aaa-tokyo.com) brand
    - I use their [lil travel pouch](https://aaa-tokyo.com/camera/camera-pouch/acam-75/) as the “wrapper” for my camera when it is in my bag.
- Find a strap that you feel comfortable with
    - I use the "vintage" Leica goodies sling strap
    - My friends like [Cooph](https://store.cooph.com/en-us)
    - The [Artisan and Artist](https://aaa-tokyo.com) straps are nice too.
    - I find the peak design straps a bit too clever.
- I like the look and utility of the leather half cases
- I use the [Arti di Mano](https://artedimano.com/Leicacases/?idx=291) from Korea. You can get it in many colors. It protects the camera and makes it look dope
- Ditch the lens cap, just get a nice filter and use that as a lens cap lol. I haven’t had my lens cap on my cameras since 2016. Never going back.
- This stuff isn’t meant to sit on shelves. It is meant to be used and capture amazing beautiful things.
- If you break your camera, Leica will repair it. Go out and break it!
- If it is on a shelf, you should sell it or give it away. You can always buy it again later.


## Software

{{< image src="/images/posts/photos-dear-dj.jpg" caption="Matthew Dear. Leica M (Typ 262), Summilux 50mm. 2017. ">}}

I am literally the worst person to help select photography software. When I started, I only used google photos. I, of course, backed up all my jpg/raw pairs so I can change that later. I recently migrated over to apple photos and I am very very happy with it. I like that it is local to my devices, and that it doesn’t have to be “cloud based” like many of the alternatives.

- If you are starting out, just use Apple Photos. Lots of photography people will get on your ass about it, but it is fine and works well.
- if you use the [SD card reader that Apple makes](https://www.apple.com/shop/product/MJYT2AM/A/lightning-to-sd-card-camera-reader) (or any usb-c sd card reader if you have the new iPhone) than you can import the photos to your phone and you don’t need to carry a computer!
- Lightroom is too hard lol. Don’t listen to folks who say you have to learn it. You don’t. I used google photos for years and it was fine too.
- There are so many neat photography software options. Play around until you find your jam. Don’t be too worried about what others think. You do you. Most people think we are already crazy for spending so much on cameras. lol
- If you are a hacker type and you use apple photos, [osxphotos](https://rhettbull.github.io/osxphotos/index.html) is a really cool piece of kit that will help you manage your library.

## It’s fun, ain’t it

{{< image src="/images/posts/photos-pickleman-peaking.jpg" caption="Jason peeking. Leica M (Typ 262), Noctilux 50mm. 2019.">}}

My favorite thing about carrying a Leica camera is how understated it looks to most people. People will think you are using a vintage camera, and not some 60mp wild beast. Lean into that. Get good shots.

**Enjoy it!**

{{< image src="/images/posts/photos-eryan.jpg" caption="Eryan. Leica M Monochrom, Summilux 50mm. 2022. ">}}

If you find that you don’t like the Leica (unlikely) sell it and get a different camera. Lots of options and most are way cheaper and just as good!

# ORIGINAL TEXT
After going down the *Leica path to extremism* over the last few years, I felt compelled to jot down a few notes and thoughts. Originally, I wrote this for a few friends who've recently purchased Leica cameras (Q2, and a M11). Thinking it might benefit others, I'm sharing it here. YMMV.

{{< image src="/images/posts/photos-congee.jpg" caption="Congee spot in Guangzhou. Leica Q. 2016">}}


I have shot with Leica cameras since I got the og Q in 2016. Since then I have gone through the [Q](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Leica_Q_), the [OG monochrom](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Leica_M_Monochrom) (my very fav camera of all time), a [262](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Leica_M_(Typ_262)) (Purchased with 10 BTC lol), and now I am shooting with a [M11](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Leica_M11). I really enjoy them. I enjoy the community and I like the vibe.

Someone once told me that Leica cameras are [Birkin bags](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Birkin_bag) for men. Lol. Not wrong. This isn't bad - but is funny.

## Shooting

{{< image src="/images/posts/photos-karin.jpg" caption="Karin Tanabe. Leica M (Typ 262), Summilux 50mm. 2022. ">}}

Don’t listen to me. Find your friend who is way better at photography and ask them. Barring that, here is what worked for me.

- The only way to get good is to shoot it constantly.
- I carried a camera almost everyday from 2016 until Covid.
- If you are shooting an M, learn to zone focus. It is helpful. I rarely use it in real life - but it was super helpful to learn. Taught me a lot about my camera.
- You almost never need a zoom lens. As my friend [Trammell](https://twitter.com/trammell) told me: "Zoom with your feet."
- Take a bunch of classes at a [local photography spot](https://www.latitudechicago.org/education). Every city has one. Find it, make friends, and take classes. None of them will be too easy. You will learn a lot.
    - I took a lighting class that blew my mind
- Print at a [local photo printing lab](https://www.latitudechicago.org/printing-services). Its fun and you learn a lot
- Take your camera everywhere. The Q is super durable. I have hit it against everything and it still works great. Same with the Ms. They are like bricks.
- My goal is to break my cameras while using them. My biggest fear is that they will get broken while they are sitting on a counter or a shelf. They are meant to be used.
- I shoot full auto. 100% all the time full auto. Even on the M (obviously manual focus). A lot of photographers will do everything on manual. I do not have time for that. Lol. Those same people will give you shit about shooting on auto. Fuck em.
- Play with the macro mode. its fun.
- One of my favorite rules of thumb for photography is: **Remove variables for better results**
    - Shoot in black and white!
    - Don't use liveview
    - Shoot only in f/8 (i know not "auto", but on the M the lens is fully manual. life is complicated)
    - also works for most things in life
- Share your [photos](https://harper.photos)!

# Buying

{{< image src="/images/posts/photos-eamon-singing.jpg" caption="Eamon singing, Chris Laughing. Leica Q. 2018. ">}}

Everyone needs a “Leica guy” to help maintain the constant drip of Leica cameras into their life. You already made the decision to get a camera based on fashion, just lean into it and live the lifestyle.

- My go-to Leica shop is [Tamarkin camera in Chicago](https://www.tamarkin.com/). They are solid and helpful. Tell Dan that Harper sent you.
- [Leica Miami](https://leicastoremiami.com/) is a decent store to buy from on the internet.
- Be careful of ordering off Amazon. [Lots of counterfeit](https://www.techdirt.com/2018/01/17/homeland-securitys-over-obsession-with-counterfeits-now-harming-innocent-buyers-counterfeit-goods-online/).
- Lot's of great equipment is waiting to be bought used. I got my dear Summilux, and my beloved Monochrom used. They are both perfect. Just make sure you are buying from someone ruputable, and trustworthy.
- If you are not using a piece of equipment, sell it. Better yet, give it to someone who will love it.

## Equipment

{{< image src="/images/posts/photos-dj.jpg" caption="My friend DJ. Leica M11, Summilux 50mm. 2023. ">}}

- I have never traveled with more than one lens.
- Learning on a fast lens is a nightmare cuz the super shallow depth of field. When I first started out, I was hitting on 5% of my shots. VERY frustrating. Call Dan at Tamarkin and buy a vintage summicron.  You will adore it, and you will have more fun. *Then* go for the fast af lens that costs a million dollars.
- I don’t really use a camera bag. I typically put my camera in a pouch, and then in my tote, or backpack. I want it quickly accessible.
	- I have always liked the [Artisan and Artist](https://aaa-tokyo.com) brand

## Software

{{< image src="/images/posts/photos-dear-dj.jpg" caption="Matthew Dear. Leica M (Typ 262), Summilux 50mm. 2017. ">}}

- Lightroom is too hard lol. Don’t listen to folks who say you have to learn it. You don’t. I used google photos for years and it was fine too.
- There are so many neat photography software options. Play around until you find your jam. Don’t be too worried about what others think. You do you. Most people think we are already crazy for spending so much on cameras. lol
- If you are a hacker type and you use apple photos, [osxphotos](https://rhettbull.github.io/osxphotos/index.html) is a really cool piece of kit that will help you manage your library.

## It’s fun, ain’t it

{{< image src="/images/posts/photos-pickleman-peaking.jpg" caption="Jason peeking. Leica M (Typ 262), Noctilux 50mm. 2019.">}}

My favorite thing about carrying a Leica camera is how understated it looks to most people. People will think you are using a vintage camera, and not some 60mp wild beast. Lean into that. Get good shots.

**Enjoy it!**

{{< image src="/images/posts/photos-eryan.jpg" caption="Eryan. Leica M Monochrom, Summilux 50mm. 2022. ">}}

If you find that you don’t like the Leica (unlikely) sell it and get a different camera. Lots of options and most are way cheaper and just as good!

総評  
全体として原文のカジュアルでやや毒のある語り口はよく再現できていますが、①意味の取り違え／欠落、②原文にないニュアンスの追加、③日本語としての不自然さ・過度なスラング、④語調の統一、⑤固有名詞・技術用語の揺れ――が点在します。以下、重大度別に指摘します。

─────────────────  
【Critical / 重大】意味が変わる・事実誤認・欠落  
1. レンガ比喩の誤訳  
　原文 “They are like bricks.” は「レンガ並みに頑丈」を示唆。訳では「レンガ並みに重くてタフ」と重量要素を追加。  
　→「レンガみたいに頑丈でタフ」に修正。  

2. Birkin 句の欠落  
　“This isn't bad – but is funny.” の「悪いことじゃない」というフォローが訳にない。  
　→「悪い意味じゃないけど笑えるよね」と追記。  

3. “I do not have time for that. Lol.” の欠落  
　マニュアル否定の理由（時間がない）が抜け、原文より攻撃的になっている。  
　→「そんなヒマはない（笑）」を補う。  

4. “solid and helpful” の落ち  
　Tamarkin の評価 “solid” (頼れる) が未反映。  
　→「信頼できて親切」と加える。  

5. “capture amazing beautiful things” 欠落  
　棚の肥やし指摘のあとにある「美しい瞬間を写すための道具」という肯定的語句が落ちている。  
　→「素晴らしい被写体をとらえるための道具」と追記。  

─────────────────  
【Major / 大】トーン・レジスター／スラングの過不足  
1. スラング過多で原文より強い口汚さ  
　例:「クソ喰らえ」「ブッ壊せ」「クソ高い fast-as-f***」など。原文にも “fuck’em” はあるが、日本語の罵語は直接的で読者を選ぶ。  
　→「気にするな」「ぶっ壊そうぜ」「バカ高い」程度に和らげ、全体の粒度を統一。  

2. 英語スラング混在  
　“fast-as-fuck” をローマ字で残すと翻訳文に見えない。  
　→「激速レンズ」「バカ速いレンズ」など日本語表現に。  

3. 語調の揺れ（俺／ですます混在はないが、語彙レンジがバラバラ）  
　「脳がぶっ飛んだ」「小賢しい」「◎」「超イケてる」等。  
　→「衝撃を受けた」「凝り過ぎ」「使い勝手も良い」「格好いい」に統一。  

4. 造語・直訳が機械的  
　“ライカ道” は原文にない創作。  
　→「ライカ沼」など実際に使われる語の方が自然。  

─────────────────  
【Medium / 中】日本語としての自然さ・文体  
1. 「レンガ並みに重くてタフ」→「レンガみたいにタフ」へ簡潔に。  
2. 「点滴みたいにチョロチョロ注入」：比喩が冗長。  
　→「少しずつ買い足させてくれる存在」。  
3. 「ガラス棚の肥やし」：意味は通るがやや古臭い。  
　→「ショーケースの飾り」程度で可。  
4. 「星の数ほどある」：口語にしては古風。  
　→「山ほどある」。  

─────────────────  
【Minor / 小】用語・表記ゆれ・細かい語法  
1. Summilux の表記  
　一般的には 「ズミルックス」だが、文中で「ズミルックス」「ズミルクス」が混在しないよう統一。  
2. “初代モノクローム” → カメラ好きには “初代Mモノクローム” の方が通りが良い。  
3. Caption 内の “50 mm” のスペース揺れ (“50mm” と統一)。  
4. “Trammell 曰く” → 「曰く」は書き言葉。口語文体なら「が言うには」に。  
5. 出典リンクの “Lot's” → 原文由来だが日本語本文に不要。  

─────────────────  
【Suggestion / 改善例（抜粋）】

重訳例だけピックアップします。

◆レンガ比喩  
現行：Q も M もレンガ並みに重くてタフ。  
改善：Q も M もレンガみたいにタフ。  

◆Birkin 節  
現行：笑ったけど間違っちゃいない。  
改善：笑ったけど間違っちゃいない。悪い意味じゃないけど可笑しいよね。  

◆マニュアル批判  
現行：マニュアル原理主義者に何を言われてもクソ喰らえ。  
改善：全部マニュアルでやる派も多いけど、そんなヒマはない（笑）。オートで撮って何が悪い、気にするな。  

─────────────────  
以上を修正すれば、意味忠実性を保ちつつ、日本語として読みやすく、かつ原文のラフさを適度に残した翻訳になります。

# ORIGINAL TEXT
After going down the *Leica path to extremism* over the last few years, I felt compelled to jot down a few notes and thoughts. Originally, I wrote this for a few friends who've recently purchased Leica cameras (Q2, and a M11). Thinking it might benefit others, I'm sharing it here. YMMV.

{{< image src="/images/posts/photos-congee.jpg" caption="Congee spot in Guangzhou. Leica Q. 2016">}}


I have shot with Leica cameras since I got the og Q in 2016. Since then I have gone through the [Q](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Leica_Q_), the [OG monochrom](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Leica_M_Monochrom) (my very fav camera of all time), a [262](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Leica_M_(Typ_262)) (Purchased with 10 BTC lol), and now I am shooting with a [M11](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Leica_M11). I really enjoy them. I enjoy the community and I like the vibe.

Someone once told me that Leica cameras are [Birkin bags](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Birkin_bag) for men. Lol. Not wrong. This isn't bad - but is funny.

## Shooting

{{< image src="/images/posts/photos-karin.jpg" caption="Karin Tanabe. Leica M (Typ 262), Summilux 50mm. 2022. ">}}

Don’t listen to me. Find your friend who is way better at photography and ask them. Barring that, here is what worked for me.

- The only way to get good is to shoot it constantly.
- I carried a camera almost everyday from 2016 until Covid.
- If you are shooting an M, learn to zone focus. It is helpful. I rarely use it in real life - but it was super helpful to learn. Taught me a lot about my camera.
- You almost never need a zoom lens. As my friend [Trammell](https://twitter.com/trammell) told me: "Zoom with your feet."
- Take a bunch of classes at a [local photography spot](https://www.latitudechicago.org/education). Every city has one. Find it, make friends, and take classes. None of them will be too easy. You will learn a lot.
    - I took a lighting class that blew my mind
- Print at a [local photo printing lab](https://www.latitudechicago.org/printing-services). Its fun and you learn a lot
- Take your camera everywhere. The Q is super durable. I have hit it against everything and it still works great. Same with the Ms. They are like bricks.
- My goal is to break my cameras while using them. My biggest fear is that they will get broken while they are sitting on a counter or a shelf. They are meant to be used.
- I shoot full auto. 100% all the time full auto. Even on the M (obviously manual focus). A lot of photographers will do everything on manual. I do not have time for that. Lol. Those same people will give you shit about shooting on auto. Fuck em.
- Play with the macro mode. its fun.
- One of my favorite rules of thumb for photography is: **Remove variables for better results**
    - Shoot in black and white!
    - Don't use liveview
    - Shoot only in f/8 (i know not "auto", but on the M the lens is fully manual. life is complicated)
    - also works for most things in life
- Share your [photos](https://harper.photos)!

# Buying

{{< image src="/images/posts/photos-eamon-singing.jpg" caption="Eamon singing, Chris Laughing. Leica Q. 2018. ">}}

Everyone needs a “Leica guy” to help maintain the constant drip of Leica cameras into their life. You already made the decision to get a camera based on fashion, just lean into it and live the lifestyle.

- My go-to Leica shop is [Tamarkin camera in Chicago](https://www.tamarkin.com/). They are solid and helpful. Tell Dan that Harper sent you.
- [Leica Miami](https://leicastoremiami.com/) is a decent store to buy from on the internet.
- Be careful of ordering off Amazon. [Lots of counterfeit](https://www.techdirt.com/2018/01/17/homeland-securitys-over-obsession-with-counterfeits-now-harming-innocent-buyers-counterfeit-goods-online/).
- Lot's of great equipment is waiting to be bought used. I got my dear Summilux, and my beloved Monochrom used. They are both perfect. Just make sure you are buying from someone ruputable, and trustworthy.
- If you are not using a piece of equipment, sell it. Better yet, give it to someone who will love it.

## Equipment

{{< image src="/images/posts/photos-dj.jpg" caption="My friend DJ. Leica M11, Summilux 50mm. 2023. ">}}

Sometimes the photography hobby is less about photography and more about equipment. I try to make sure I have minimized my gear acquisition syndrome ([GAS](https://www.theinspiredeye.net/cameras/gear-acquisition-syndrome/)) and focused on shooting.

- Lenses. OMG. I have gone through a lot of lenses. I finally settled on shooting primarily with a [50m Summilux](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Summilux). Through a bunch of experimentation I realized I like how 50mm works, how it looks, and how it frames.
- I have never traveled with more than one lens.
- Learning on a fast lens is a nightmare cuz the super shallow depth of field. When I first started out, I was hitting on 5% of my shots. VERY frustrating. Call Dan at Tamarkin and buy a vintage summicron.  You will adore it, and you will have more fun. *Then* go for the fast af lens that costs a million dollars.
- I don’t really use a camera bag. I typically put my camera in a pouch, and then in my tote, or backpack. I want it quickly accessible.

─────────────────  
【Critical / 重大】意味が変わる・事実誤認・欠落  
1. レンガ比喩の誤訳  
　原文 “They are like bricks.” は「レンガ並みに頑丈」を示唆。訳では「レンガ並みに重くてタフ」と重量要素を追加。

　→「悪い意味じゃないけど笑えるよね」と追記。

　マニュアル否定の理由（時間がない）が抜け、原文より攻撃的になっている。  
　→「そんなヒマはない（笑）」を補う。

　Tamarkin の評価 “solid” (頼れる) が未反映。  
　→「信頼できて親切」と加える。  

5. “capture amazing beautiful things” 欠落  
　棚の肥やし指摘のあとにある「美しい瞬間を写すための道具」という肯定的語句が落ちている。  
　→「素晴らしい被写体をとらえるための道具」と追記。  

─────────────────  
【Major / 大】トーン・レジスター／スラングの過不足  
1. スラング過多で原文より強い口汚さ  
　例:「クソ喰らえ」「ブッ壊せ」「クソ高い fast-as-f***」など。原文にも “fuck’em” はあるが、日本語の罵語は直接的で読者を選ぶ。  
　→「気にするな」「ぶっ壊そうぜ」「バカ高い」程度に和らげ、全体の粒度を統一。  

2. 英語スラング混在  
　“fast-as-fuck” をローマ字で残すと翻訳文に見えない。  
　→「激速レンズ」「バカ速いレンズ」など日本語表現に。

　「脳がぶっ飛んだ」「小賢しい」「◎」「超イケてる」等。

4. 造語・直訳が機械的  
　“ライカ道” は原文にない創作。  
　→「ライカ沼」など実際に使われる語の方が自然。  

─────────────────  
【Medium / 中】日本語としての自然さ・文体  
1. 「レンガ並みに重くてタフ」→「レンガみたいにタフ」へ簡潔に。

─────────────────  
【Minor / 小】用語・表記ゆれ・細かい語法

- カメラバッグはあまり使わない。ポーチに入れてトートかバックパックへ。すぐ取り出せることが大事。  
  - [Artisan & Artist](https://aaa-tokyo.com) が好きで、  
  - そこの [小型トラベルポーチ](https://aaa-tokyo.com/camera/camera-pouch/acam-75/) を“包み”代わりにしている。  
- ストラップはフィーリング重視。  
  - 僕はライカ純正 “Vintage Goodies” スリングストラップ  
  - 友人は [Cooph](https://store.cooph.com/en-us) を推している  
  - [Artisan & Artist](https://aaa-tokyo.com) のものも良い  
  - Peak Design はちょっと凝り過ぎかな  
- レザーのハーフケースは見た目も使い勝手も良い。  
  - 韓国の [Arti di Mano](https://artedimano.com/Leicacases/?idx=291) を愛用。色も豊富で格好いい。  
- レンズキャップは外して、質のいいフィルターをキャップ代わりに。2016年からずっとこのスタイルでもう戻れない。  
- この道具はショーケースの飾りじゃない。素晴らしい被写体を捉えるためのものだ。  
- 壊れてもライカが修理してくれる。だから外に持ち出して、思い切り使い倒そうぜ。  
- もし棚の飾りになっているなら、売るか譲ろう。また欲しくなったらあとで買い戻せる。  

## ソフトウェア

{{< image src="/images/posts/photos-dear-dj.jpg" caption="Matthew Dear. Leica M (Typ 262), Summilux 50mm. 2017. ">}}

ソフト選びに関しては僕がいちばん頼りにならない。最初は Google Photos しか使わず、JPEG/RAW のペアは全部バックアップしていた。最近 Apple Photos に移行したらとても満足している。データが手元にあり、ほかのクラウドサービスのように“全部クラウド”でなくても済むのが最高だ。

- これから始めるなら Apple Photos で十分。写真ガチ勢に何を言われても気にするな。  
- [Apple 純正 SD カードリーダー](https://www.apple.com/shop/product/MJYT2AM/A/lightning-to-sd-card-camera-reader)（USB-C 版も可）があれば、写真を iPhone に直接取り込めるのでパソコンが要らない。  
- Lightroom は難しすぎる。覚えろと言われても無視してOK。僕は何年も Google Photos で問題なかった。  
- 写真ソフトは山ほどある。いろいろ試して自分の“推し”を見つけよう。他人の目なんてどうでもいい。そもそもカメラに大金を突っ込んでいる時点で十分イカれてるんだから（笑）  
- ハッカー気質で Apple Photos を使うなら、[osxphotos](https://rhettbull.github.io/osxphotos/index.html) はライブラリ管理にとても便利。  

## 楽しいだろ？

{{< image src="/images/posts/photos-pickleman-peaking.jpg" caption="Jason peeking. Leica M (Typ 262), Noctilux 50mm. 2019.">}}

ライカを肩から下げて歩いていると、多くの人はビンテージカメラだと思う。でも実は 60MP のモンスター。そのギャップを生かして良い写真を撮ろう。

**楽しめよ！**

{{< image src="/images/posts/photos-eryan.jpg" caption="Eryan. Leica M Monochrom, Summilux 50mm. 2022. ">}}

もしライカが合わないと感じたら（まずないけど）、売ってほかのカメラを買えばいい。選択肢は山ほどあって、大抵はもっと安くて同じくらい優秀だ。

{{< image src="/images/posts/photos-busking.jpg" caption="Some light operatic busking. Leica Q. 2016. ">}}

────────────────────────────────────────

Legend for severity

MA = Major (strong nuance loss / jarring to target readers)

MI = Minor (stylistic polishing)

────────────────────────
1. CR  “*Leica path to extremism*”

2. MA  “YMMV.”

   • TL: 「マニュアル信者のツッコミは無視。」

   • TL: 「その後で“沼レンズ”に行けばいい。」  
   • Issue: “af” ＝ “as fuck” (めちゃくちゃ明るい) が消滅。価格の誇張も未反映。  
   • Fix: 「そのあとで“めちゃくちゃ明るくてバカ高いレンズ”に手を出せばいい。」

   • TL: 「『ヴィンテージ』ライカのグッディーズスリング」  
   • Issue: “Goodies” is mis-heard; originalはLeica “GOODIES”シリーズではなく “Gordy’s”? 不明確。  
   • Fix: 公式名調査の上「（例）Gordy’sのスリングストラップ」など正確に。

6. MA  “Zoom with your feet.”
   • TL keeps literal translation but loses imperative nuance.  
   • Fix: 「足で寄れ（ズームしろ）」と命令形で。

7. MA  “remove variables” little nuance: Fine.

8. MO  “My goal is to break my cameras while using them.”
   • TL ok but could keep intentional humor: 「ぶっ壊れるくらい使い倒すのが目標。」。

9. MO  Lightning-to-SD link sentence
   • “than you can import…” typo “than” in ST not carried; no issue.

10. MO  “Lean into that. Get good shots.”
   • TL: 「そのギャップを楽しみつつ、いいショットを狙おう。」  
   • Nuance OK but “Lean into” (積極的に利用しろ) could be stronger: 「その錯覚を逆手に取ってガンガン撮ろう。」

────────────────────────
B. Nuance / Cultural References
────────────────────────
1. MA  “Birkin bags for men”
   • TL literal. Could append short gloss for readers unfamiliar with Birkin: 「超高級バッグ」で男性版。

2. MO  “OG”
   • TL uses 「初代」 once but leaves “OG” earlier. Choose one and keep consistent.

3. MO  BTC anecdote
   • The “lol” after 10 BTC lost; could add 「笑」「草」等。

────────────────────────
C. Tone / Register Consistency
────────────────────────
1. MA  Pronoun switching 私→僕
   • Maintain one persona. Original is casual & gender-neutral male voice.  
   • Pick 「俺」or「僕」and stick with it.

2. MA  Overall politeness
   • Original ≒ casual / slang / profanity. TL slips into semi-formal (“です/ます” zero but語調穏やか). Decide policy: keepタメ口＋軽い俗語 to mirror source.

3. MO  Random omission of “lol”, “haha”, etc. These are key to voice. Re-insert with 「笑」「w」.

4. MO  “It’s fun, ain’t it”
   • ST’s colloquialism lost. Add 「楽しいだろ？」or similar.

D. Grammar / Naturalness
────────────────────────
1. MO  「ただ、僕に効いたことを挙げておく。」
   • 不自然。→「そんな僕が効果があったと思うことを挙げておく。」

   • Tech風で悪くないが硬い。→「要素を減らせば結果は良くなる」。

3. MI  「ファッションで選んだのだから、ライフスタイルも楽しもう。」
   • Slightly stiff. →「見た目で選んだなら、もう全力で“ライカ生活”を楽しもう。」

4. MI  「レンズキャップは捨てて」
   • 日本人は文字通り捨ててしまう危険。「外して」or「しまって」。

────────────────────────
E. Terminology Consistency
────────────────────────
1. “Q” → sometimes “初代 Q”, later “Q” only. Fine but ensure first mention explains “Q”.
2. “Monochrom” written “Monochrom” & “モノクロ”; unify.
3. “Summilux / Summicron” – once “ズミクロン”、once “Summicron”; pick one (カタカナ推奨) and stay consistent.

F. Additions / Omissions
────────────────────────
1. MA  Omitted clause “I do not have time for that.”  
2. MO  “None of them will be too easy.” simplified; could add 「どのクラスも決して“楽勝”ではない」.
3. MO  “They are like bricks.” partly gone; re-add “まるでレンガ並みに頑丈”.
4. MI  Image captions were not translated—OK if site keeps English, but decide.

G. Machine-like / Literal Spots
────────────────────────
1. 「僕に効いたことを挙げておく」– literal “worked for me”.
2. 「使ってこそ価値がある」 repetitive; could vary diction.
3. Formulas like「〜が○○だが〜。」straight calque; polish.

────────────────────────
H. Formatting / Readability
────────────────────────
1. List items: English bullet icons kept; fine.
2. Random half-角 spaces around URLs; unify.
3. Katakana long vowel marks (“アーティザン・アンド・アーティスト” vs “Artisan and Artist”)—choose one scheme.

────────────────────────
Suggested Global Re-write Guidelines
────────────────────────
• Voice: informal male, occasional英語スラング＋日本語スラング融合。“です／ます”排除。  
• Keep all profanities and “lol” equivalents lightly toned but present.  
• Localise English idioms (YMMV, Zoom with your feet, fast af) with brief補足 if needed.  
• Harmonise terminology in Katakana.  
• Stick to one first-person pronoun.  
• Retain playful exaggerations (“brick”, “million-dollar lens”).

With the above corrections the translation will read naturally to Japanese Leica geeks while staying 100 % faithful to the irreverent, humorous spirit of the original.

Issues are grouped by ❶Severity → ❷Category → ❸Item.  
Each item contains (a) problem, (b) why it matters, (c) concrete fix.

━━━━━━━━ 1. CRITICAL ━━━━━━━━

  • Strap brand replaced with a different company  
    a) “I use the ‘vintage’ Leica goodies sling strap” → 「俺は Gordy’s のスリングストラップ」

  • “This isn’t bad – but is funny.” completely dropped “This isn’t bad”.  
    a) Translation: 「的確すぎて笑う」  
    b) Loses the author’s “not a dig” nuance; could be read as contemptuous in JP.  
    c) Add: 「悪く言うつもりはないが、そのたとえが面白くて笑った。」

    a) English is casual but not teen-slangy. JP tone reads younger, 2-channelish, sometimes rude.  
    b) Alienates older JP Leica crowd; skews author’s persona.  
    c) Replace with light-casual “僕 / 私”, drop “w”, use 「すごく」「かなり」 instead of 「激ウマ」 et al. Maintain occasional profanity with 控えめスラング (e.g. 「クソくらえ」→「クソ喰らえ」に維持可).  

2-B  Unnatural Collocations  
  • 「学びが山盛り」「目標は『ぶっ壊れるくらい使い倒す』こと」  
    a) Sounds gamer-blog, not camera-blog.  
    b) Replace with 「得るものが多い」「壊れるほど使い倒すのが目標」.

2-C  Omitted Micro-Humor & Parentheticals  
  • “i know not ‘auto’, but on the M the lens is fully manual. life is complicated” → JP drops the self-deprecating joke.  
  • “Every city has one. Find it,” → JP loses call-to-action “探そう”.

  • “Birkin bags for men” given as 「超高級バッグの男性版」 – serviceable, but JP readers may miss Birkin’s notoriety.  
    Provide gloss or footnote: 「エルメスのバーキンのような存在――男版の“憧れバッグ”」.

3-A  Minor Meaning Shifts  
  • “felt compelled” → 「勢いで」: “勢い” = whim; original = 内的衝動.  
    Suggest: 「どうしても書き留めたくなった」.  

  • “I really enjoy them.” sentence disappeared.  
    Re-insert: 「カメラそのものが大好きだし――」.

  • “OG” translated once as 「初代」 but later left in English (“og Q” caption area). Keep unified: 「初代」「オリジナル」.  
  • “zone focus” sometimes Katakana? Provide Japanese term first use: 「ゾーンフォーカス（置きピン）」.

  • English links inside JP sentences lack 「」 or parentheses; looks cluttered.

4-A  Machine-like Literal Phrasing

    Vary expression: 「とても楽しいうえ、学びも多い」.  

4-B  Profanity Register  
  • 「クソ喰らえ」 is stronger than “Fuck ’em” in JP; “クソくらえ” or 「知ったこっちゃない」 is closer.

原文のカジュアルで毒舌ぎみの語り口・ユーモアはかなり再現できている一方、①極端化・誇張表現のニュアンス抜け、②数か所の軽微な訳抜け／誤訳、③日本語としてのこなれなさ・機械訳っぽさ、④英語俗語の処理不足、⑤一貫性の揺らぎ（一人称・語調・表記）が目立つ。  
以下、重大度別に問題点と改善案を列挙する。

──────────────────
A. 重大度：高（意味を損なう誤訳・訳抜け）
──────────────────
1. “Leica path to extremism”  
　訳: 「“ライカ道”を突き詰めてきた結果」  
　問題: “extremism”＝「過激さ」「極端さ」。単に「突き詰めた」では熱狂・狂信ぶりが弱い。  
　改善: 「ここ数年、ライカ道を“過激派”レベルまで突き進んだ結果」等。

2. “Not wrong.”（Birkin たとえ）  
　訳: 割愛。「悪く言うつもりはないが～」のみ。  
　問題: 「確かにそうかもね」という半肯定ニュアンスが落ちた。  
　改善: 「笑ったけど“間違ってはいない”」。

3. “Taught me a lot about my camera.”（ゾーンフォーカス段落）  
　訳: 欠落。  
　改善: 「そのおかげでカメラの特性を深く理解できた」など追加。

4. “fast af lens that costs a million dollars.”  
　訳: “fast af レンズ（fast as f*ck／オートフォーカスの掛け言葉）”  
　問題: “af”は原文では “as fuck” の略で「超速い」のみ。AF（オートフォーカス）とは無関係。誤誘導。  
　改善: 「クソ高い“fast-as-fuck”なレンズ」or 「死ぬほど明るい高額レンズ」。

5. 技術用語のゆらぎ  
　例）“Summilux” → 「ズミルックス」「ズミルクス」併存（50 m / 50mm なども混在）。  
　改善: 表記統一（ズミルックス / 50 mm など）。

──────────────────
B. 重大度：中（ニュアンス欠落・語調/口調の不整合）
──────────────────
6. 原文の F ワードの処理  
　① “Fuck em.” → 「クソくらえ」(OK だがやや硬い)  
　② その他の F ワードは弱め表現に置き換え。  
　問題: トーンが統一されず、原文の破天荒さが弱体化。  
　改善: 全体で統一した罵り語レベルを決め、言い換え／伏せ字で揃える。

7. “Leica guy” 段  
　訳: 「ライカの供給を絶やさない “Leica Guy” は必須」  
　問題: “constant drip”＝「常に点滴のようにライカが供給される」ユーモア抜け。  
　改善: 「ライカを点滴のようにチョロチョロ注入してくれる “Leica Guy” を確保せよ」など。

8. “They are like bricks.”  
　訳: 「レンガのように頑丈」  
　ニュアンス: “brick” は「武骨で重い」含み。  
　改善: 「レンガ並みに重くてタフ」。

9. 「fast af」以外の英俗語  
　・“YMMV”を「感じ方は人それぞれ」で訳したのは良いが、カッコ内だけ英語表記。  
　改善: 「感じ方は人それぞれ（YMMV＝Your Mileage May Vary）」など脚注的補足。

10. “lean into it and live the lifestyle”  
　訳: 「そのままライフスタイルを楽しもう」  
　やや直訳風。  
　改善: 「開き直って“ライカ様式”を満喫しよう」。

──────────────────
C. 重大度：低（日本語としてのぎこちなさ・表記ゆれ・細かな誤字）
──────────────────
11. 主語・一人称の揺れ  
　「僕」「私」は混在していないが、原文の荒い口調に対して「僕」はやや優等生。  
　改善: “オレ”/“俺” などに統一するか、逆にもう少し柔らかくするなら F ワードも和らげる。

12. 半角/全角・スペース  
　「50 mm」「10 BTC」「2016 年」等、半角空白や単位表記がバラバラ。  
　改善: typographic ガイドを作り一括修正。

13. 「fast af lens」の注釈書き込み方  
　全訳内で唯一 *スラッシュ説明* を使っており浮く。脚注方式に。

14. “地元の写真コミュニティ”  
　リンク先はシカゴの特定施設。注で“Chicago” を示した方が親切。

15. “簡単すぎる講座は一つもない” → 「やさしすぎる講座は～」の方が自然。

16. 「笑」をカッコ内に添える場所と “Lol.” の扱いが不規則。  
　→ 「（笑）」or「w」に統一。

17. “ruputable” スペルミスは原文由来だが、訳文では「信頼できる」にしたのでOK。念のため脚注で「原文ママ」の注釈を加えても良い。

──────────────────
D. その他（訳し方のアイデア）
──────────────────
18. “Remove variables for better results”  
　現訳: 「変数を減らせば結果は良くなる」  
　提案: 「余計な変数を潰せば、結果は勝手に良くなる」  
　…と俗っぽさを足す。

19. “This stuff isn’t meant to sit on shelves.”  
　現訳: 「これは飾るための道具ではない。」  
　提案: 「ガラス棚の肥やしにするモンじゃない。」

──────────────────
【まとめ】
致命的な情報欠落は少ないが、“extremism” や “fast-as-fuck” など原文の尖った語感が薄れ、俗語の取扱いがぶれているためトーンに一貫性がない。  
上記 A～D のポイントを修正し、①極端さ・毒舌の保持、②技術用語の統一、③口語リズムの滑らかさを整えれば、「最初から日本語で書いたかのような」完璧な訳文に仕上がる。

総評  
全体として原文のカジュアルでやや毒のある語り口はよく再現できていますが、①意味の取り違え／欠落、②原文にないニュアンスの追加、③日本語としての不自然さ・過度なスラング、④語調の統一、⑤固有名詞・技術用語の揺れ――が点在します。以下、重大度別に指摘します。

─────────────────  
【Critical / 重大】意味が変わる・事実誤認・欠落  
1. レンガ比喩の誤訳  
　原文 “They are like bricks.” は「レンガ並みに頑丈」を示唆。訳では「レンガ並みに重くてタフ」と重量要素を追加。  
　→「レンガみたいに頑丈でタフ」に修正。  

2. Birkin 句の欠落  
　“This isn't bad – but is funny.” の「悪いことじゃない」というフォローが訳にない。  
　→「悪い意味じゃないけど笑えるよね」と追記。  

3. “I do not have time for that. Lol.” の欠落  
　マニュアル否定の理由（時間がない）が抜け、原文より攻撃的になっている。  
　→「そんなヒマはない（笑）」を補う。  

4. “solid and helpful” の落ち  
　Tamarkin の評価 “solid” (頼れる) が未反映。  
　→「信頼できて親切」と加える。  

5. “capture amazing beautiful things” 欠落  
　棚の肥やし指摘のあとにある「美しい瞬間を写すための道具」という肯定的語句が落ちている。  
　→「素晴らしい被写体をとらえるための道具」と追記。  

─────────────────  
【Major / 大】トーン・レジスター／スラングの過不足  
1. スラング過多で原文より強い口汚さ  
　例:「クソ喰らえ」「ブッ壊せ」「クソ高い fast-as-f***」など。原文にも “fuck’em” はあるが、日本語の罵語は直接的で読者を選ぶ。  
　→「気にするな」「ぶっ壊そうぜ」「バカ高い」程度に和らげ、全体の粒度を統一。  

2. 英語スラング混在  
　“fast-as-fuck” をローマ字で残すと翻訳文に見えない。  
　→「激速レンズ」「バカ速いレンズ」など日本語表現に。  

3. 語調の揺れ（俺／ですます混在はないが、語彙レンジがバラバラ）  
　「脳がぶっ飛んだ」「小賢しい」「◎」「超イケてる」等。  
　→「衝撃を受けた」「凝り過ぎ」「使い勝手も良い」「格好いい」に統一。  

4. 造語・直訳が機械的  
　“ライカ道” は原文にない創作。  
　→「ライカ沼」など実際に使われる語の方が自然。  

─────────────────  
【Medium / 中】日本語としての自然さ・文体  
1. 「レンガ並みに重くてタフ」→「レンガみたいにタフ」へ簡潔に。  
2. 「点滴みたいにチョロチョロ注入」：比喩が冗長。  
　→「少しずつ買い足させてくれる存在」。  
3. 「ガラス棚の肥やし」：意味は通るがやや古臭い。  
　→「ショーケースの飾り」程度で可。  
4. 「星の数ほどある」：口語にしては古風。  
　→「山ほどある」。  

─────────────────  
【Minor / 小】用語・表記ゆれ・細かい語法  
1. Summilux の表記  
　一般的には 「ズミルックス」だが、文中で「ズミルックス」「ズミルクス」が混在しないよう統一。  
2. “初代モノクローム” → カメラ好きには “初代Mモノクローム” の方が通りが良い。  
3. Caption 内の “50 mm” のスペース揺れ (“50mm” と統一)。  
4. “Trammell 曰く” → 「曰く」は書き言葉。口語文体なら「が言うには」に。  
5. 出典リンクの “Lot's” → 原文由来だが日本語本文に不要。  

─────────────────  
【Suggestion / 改善例（抜粋）】

重訳例だけピックアップします。

◆レンガ比喩  
現行：Q も M もレンガ並みに重くてタフ。  
改善：Q も M もレンガみたいにタフ。  

◆Birkin 節  
現行：笑ったけど間違っちゃいない。  
改善：笑ったけど間違っちゃいない。悪い意味じゃないけど可笑しいよね。  

◆マニュアル批判  
現行：マニュアル原理主義者に何を言われてもクソ喰らえ。  
改善：全部マニュアルでやる派も多いけど、そんなヒマはない（笑）。オートで撮って何が悪い、気にするな。  

─────────────────  
以上を修正すれば、意味忠実性を保ちつつ、日本語として読みやすく、かつ原文のラフさを適度に残した翻訳になります。
